tit.e: Kudaranokonikishi clan
Kudaranokonikishi clan
Kudaranokonikishi clan

sen.j: 百済王（くだらのこにきし）氏は、百済最後の王である義慈王直系の百済王善光を始祖とする日本の氏族。
sen.e: The Kudaranokonikishi was a Japanese clan whose founder Zenko KUDARANOKONIKISHI was a descendent of the last king of Baekje, King Giji.
The Kudaranokonikishi was a Japanese clan whose founder Zenko KUDARANOKONIKISHI was a descendent of the last king of Baekje, King Giji.
The Kudaranokonikishi was a Japanese clan whose founder Zenko KUDARANOKONIKISHI was a descendent of the last king of Baekje, King Giji.

sen.j: 百済を氏・姓（本姓）とする。
sen.e: His full name was Kudara.
His full name was Kudara.
His full name was Kudara.

sen.j: 持統天皇朝に王（こにきし）カバネを賜ったとされる。
sen.e: He received the hereditary title Konikishi during the reign of Empress Jito.
He received the hereditary title Konikishi during the reign of Empress Jito.
He received the hereditary title Konikishi during the reign of Empress Jito.

sen.j: 当初より主たる者に従五位下以上が与えられ、中下級官人にとどまる者が多い帰化人のうち別格の地位にあった。
sen.e: The rank Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or higher was given to those from the Kudaranokonikishi Clan from the beginning, although it was very rare to receive such a high rank among naturalized people who usually remained as lower or middle ranked government officials.

The rank Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or higher was given to those from the Kudaranokonikishi Clan from the beginning, although it was very rare to receive such a high rank among naturalized people who usually remained as lower or middle ranked government officials.

The rank Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or higher was given to those from the Kudaranokonikishi Clan from the beginning, although it was very rare to receive such a high rank among naturalized people who usually remained as lower or middle ranked government officials.

sen.j: 概説
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 王という特殊なカバネの示すとおり、かつての百済を象徴する存在であったと思われる。
sen.e: As this unique heridetry title, Kudara (meaning King) shows, the clan was seen as the symbol of what used to be Baekje.
As this unique heridetry title, Kudara (meaning King) shows, the clan was seen as the symbol of what used to be Baekje.
As this unique heridetry title, Kudara (meaning King) shows, the clan was seen as the symbol of what used to be Baekje.

sen.j: また延暦9年（790年）菅野朝臣の改姓上表で百済王仁貞らが後継者然と名を連ねていることより、百済系氏族の長的地位にあったことが知られる（『続日本紀』七月一七日条）。
sen.e: In 790, when Sugano no Asomi presented a change of the family name to the emperor, there was a name of Jintei KUDARANOKONIKISHI along with successors,and therefore it shows that he was in the highest position, and thus the head of the Kudara Clan ("Shoku Nihongi," July 17).

In 790, when Sugano no Asomi presented a change of the family name to the emperor, there was a name of Jintei KUDARANOKONIKISHI along with successors,and therefore it shows that he was in the highest position, and thus the head of the Kudara Clan ("Shoku Nihongi," July 17).

In 790, when Sugano no Asomi presented a change of the family name to the emperor, there was a name of Jintei KUDARANOKONIKISHI along with successors,and therefore it shows that he was in the highest position, and thus the head of the Kudara Clan ("Shoku Nihongi," July 17).

sen.j: 「こにきし」という読みの由来については百済王を参照。
sen.e: Refer to Kudaranokonikishi for its origin of the pronunciation.
Refer to Kudaranokonikishi for its origin of the pronunciation.
Refer to Kudaranokonikishi for its origin of the pronunciation.

sen.j: 平安時代は、初期とくに桓武天皇の母（高野新笠）が百済系和氏であったため「百済王等者朕之外戚也。」（同二月二七日条）と厚遇を受けた。
sen.e: In the early Heian Period, because a mother of the Emperor Kanmu (TAKANO no Niigasa) was Baekje Japanese, the emperor stated that 'the descendants of Kudaranokoshiki Clan are our relatives,' and thus recieved special treatment (on Febuary 27).

In the early Heian Period, because a mother of the Emperor Kanmu (TAKANO no Niigasa) was Baekje Japanese, the emperor stated that 'the descendants of Kudaranokoshiki Clan are our relatives,' and thus recieved special treatment (on Febuary 27).

In the early Heian Period, because a mother of the Emperor Kanmu (TAKANO no Niigasa) was Baekje Japanese, the emperor stated that 'the descendants of Kudaranokoshiki Clan are our relatives,' and thus recieved special treatment (on Febuary 27).

sen.j: 女子を桓武天皇・嵯峨天皇の後宮に入れ、天皇と私的なつながりを結んで繁栄を得た。
sen.e: Their daughters were sent to Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Saga to become their wives in order to build connections on personal levels in which they gained prosperity.
Their daughters were sent to Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Saga to become their wives in order to build connections on personal levels in which they gained prosperity.
Their daughters were sent to Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Saga to become their wives in order to build connections on personal levels in which they gained prosperity.

sen.j: 本貫地河内国交野への天皇遊猟の記事は桓武朝以降、国史に多数見られる。
sen.e: There are numerous historical records after the reign of Emperor Kanmu regarding the emperor going to Katano in Kawachi Province (the birthplace of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan) for hunting purposes.
There are numerous historical records after the reign of Emperor Kanmu regarding the emperor going to Katano in Kawachi Province (the birthplace of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan) for hunting purposes.
There are numerous historical records after the reign of Emperor Kanmu regarding the emperor going to Katano in Kawachi Province (the birthplace of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan) for hunting purposes.

sen.j: 百済王氏の本拠地は当初難波にあったが、その後北河内交野郡中宮郷（現・大阪府枚方市中宮）に本拠を移し、この地に百済王の祀廟と百済寺を建立した。
sen.e: Although their base was in Nanba at first, it was later moved to Nakamiyago, Kitagawachi Katano District (now known as Nakamiya, Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture), and Shibyo of Kudaranokonikishi and Hyakusai-ji Temple were constructed there.

Although their base was in Nanba at first, it was later moved to Nakamiyago, Kitagawachi Katano District (now known as Nakamiya, Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture), and Shibyo of Kudaranokonikishi and Hyakusai-ji Temple were constructed there.

Although their base was in Nanba at first, it was later moved to Nakamiyago, Kitagawachi Katano District (now known as Nakamiya, Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture), and Shibyo of Kudaranokonikishi and Hyakusai-ji Temple were constructed there.

sen.j: 百済寺は中世に焼失したが、百済王神社は今も大阪府枚方市に残る。
sen.e: Although Hyakusai-ji Temple was burnt down, Kudarao-jinja Shrine still exists in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.
Although Hyakusai-ji Temple was burnt down, Kudarao-jinja Shrine still exists in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.
Although Hyakusai-ji Temple was burnt down, Kudarao-jinja Shrine still exists in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良時代末期には俊哲が陸奥鎮守将軍征夷副使などに任じ、武鏡は出羽国守となるなど、敬福以来東北地方の経営と征夷事業に関わり、平安時代中期まで中級貴族として存続した。
sen.e: They participated in the management of Tohoku region and the Seii project by Shuntettu being Commander-in-Chief of the Defense as well as Seii Fukushi and Mukyo being the governor of Dewa Province in the late Nara Period, and they held their positions as middle ranked nobles until the mid Heian Period.

They participated in the management of Tohoku region and the Seii project by Shuntettu being Commander-in-Chief of the Defense as well as Seii Fukushi and Mukyo being the governor of Dewa Province in the late Nara Period, and they held their positions as middle ranked nobles until the mid Heian Period.

They participated in the management of Tohoku region and the Seii project by Shuntettu being Commander-in-Chief of the Defense as well as Seii Fukushi and Mukyo being the governor of Dewa Province in the late Nara Period, and they held their positions as middle ranked nobles until the mid Heian Period.

sen.j: なお、俊哲が坂上田村麻呂の副将軍として日高見国へ遠征したことから、百済王氏の一部かその縁者が北上盆地に定住し、岩手県南部各地に現在でも百済姓を名乗る者が散見される。
sen.e: When Shuntetsu went on expedition as a vice-shogun (SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro being shogun) to Hitakami Province, some members of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan or their relatives settled down in the Kitagami Basin, and therefore those who have Kudara as their last names are still seen in southern parts of Iwate Prefecture.

When Shuntetsu went on an expedition as a vice-shogun (SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro being shogun) to Hitakami Province, some members of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan or their relatives settled down in the Kitagami Basin, and therefore those who have Kudara as their last names are still seen in southern parts of Iwate Prefecture.

When Shuntetsu went on an expedition as a vice-shogun (SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro being shogun) to Hitakami Province, some members of the Kudaranokonikishi Clan or their relatives settled down in the Kitagami Basin, and therefore those who have Kudara as their last names are still seen in southern parts of Iwate Prefecture.

sen.j: 全体としては近畿から福岡にかけての瀬戸内海沿岸に多い。
sen.e: On the whole, those who have Kudara as their last name are often found around the Seto Inland Sea from the Kinki area to Fukuoka.

sen.j: 扶余豊璋：善光の兄で、善光と共に倭国の人質となっていたが、鬼室福信ら百済遺臣に迎えられて帰国する。
sen.e: Buyeo PUNG: a brother of Zenko who was held as hostages with his brother in Japan, yet later returned with a former Baekje retainer, Fukushin KISHITSU.
sen.cmt: 以降は箇条書きのような形で書かれていると理解し、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: Buyeo PUNG: a brother of Zenko who was held as a hostage with his brother in Japan, yet later returned with a former Baekje retainer, Fukushin KISHITSU.
Buyeo PUNG: a brother of Zenko who was held as a hostage with his brother in Japan, yet later returned with a former Baekje retainer, Fukushin KISHITSU.

sen.j: 白村江の戦いの後に高句麗に逃れたが、唐に捕らえられて流罪となる。
sen.e: Although he escaped to Goguryeo after losing in the Battle of Hakusukinoe, he was captured by Tang Dynasty China and sentenced to exile.
Although he escaped to Goguryeo after losing in the Battle of Hakusukinoe, he was captured by the Tang Dynasty of China and sentenced to exile.
Although he escaped to Goguryeo after losing in the Battle of Hakusukinoe, he was captured by the Tang Dynasty of China and sentenced to exile.

sen.j: 百済王善光（601年 - 687年）：持統天皇より百済王の氏姓を賜る。
sen.e: Zenko KUDARANOKONIKISHI (601 - 687): Received the hereditary title of Kudaranokonikishi from the Empress Jito.

sen.j: 『公卿補任』天平廿一午条百済王敬福の尻付には「南典弟也」とある。
sen.e: On the back of "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles) 天平廿一午条百済王敬福, it says 'Nanten's younger brother.'
sen.cmt: 天平廿一午条百済王敬福の意味や読みがどこにも見つかりませんでした。
